review: Fire Stick versus Apple TVI just picked up this Fire Stick on deep discount - it was priced so low I decided that I would pick it up and see what I can do with it.The short is that it is a great device, but the Apple TV provides more function.Ease of Use:Both are easy to use.  Apple TV has a more direct UI panel, while Fire Stick has a hierarchical menu system.Both are easy to plug in.  Apple TV has Ethernet and optical audio capability too.Form factor:The Fire Stick is a stick, but it also requires an AC power adapter.The Apple TV is a little box with a power cord.The Apple TV is a nicer-built device, with a more simple & fancier aluminum remote.Streaming:The Apple TV is a pro at dealing with streaming video and audio from my local devices.The Fire Stick can only do a small set of this stuff, and only with 3rd party apps.In all, I like them both.  The Apple TV provides a bit more capability and simplicity, but is $50 more.

review: I really wanted to give this a good review however I feel one of the key features are seriously lacking in functionality. I finally discovered yesterday that the software in both the Fire TV Stick and set-top box do not support quotes, forward and back slash characters in the wireless security key, so you end up trying endlessly to type the passkey in only to have the device to fail to connect with no suggestive error message about what the problem is. I was able to work around the issue for the set-top box by plugging directly into the route via a network cable, but the only solution for using the Fire Stick is to change your wireless key to remove any non-supported characters from your passkey. I was surprised this is even an issue given that every other wireless device I use (there are 12 other wireless devices connected in my network including Tivo's, Printers, Smartphones, Kindles, Nook's and multiple computers) and have used didn't have this limitation, hopefully Amazon Developers will go back and fix this bug and include the fix in future builds for the Stick, however I'm not waiting for a fix and will be returning this device.
